alert.note: Alert for Fairfax; Fauquier; Loudoun; Prince William (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 29 at 4:02PM EDT until July 29 at 4:45PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: The National Weather Service in Sterling Virginia has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... South central Loudoun County in northern Virginia... Western Fairfax County in northern Virginia... Northern Fauquier County in northern Virginia... Northwestern Prince William County in northern Virginia... * Until 445 PM EDT. * At 401 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Hume, or 10 miles northwest of Warrenton, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damaging winds will cause some trees and large branches to fall. This could injure those outdoors, as well as damage homes and vehicles. Roadways may become blocked by downed trees. Localized power outages are possible. Unsecured light objects may become projectiles. * Locations impacted include... South Riding, Linton Hall, Bull Run, Haymarket, The Plains, Hume, Gainesville, New Baltimore, Marshall, Catharpin, Woolsey, Broken Hill, Greenwich, Meadowville, Airlie, Broad Run, Markham, Ashville and Ada. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in Sterling Virginia.
